page.title: 11Farming (5)
page.content: The few Nurseries in the area all lie along B.2133, on Lower Greensand soil, which is rich, light and workable. There are glasshouses for ornamentals near Adversane, and a few acres of soft-fruit at Broadford Bridge. To the east is a 15-acre garden centre for conifers and roses, with a nursery of ornamental fish and aquatic plants. Changes are occurring. Dairy farmers have been adversely affected by milk quotas; a few have had to sell up and others may do so. The pig farmers feel forgotten by Government and the E.E.C. Nurseries face unfair competition from continental growers, whose fuel costs are subsidised. Now farmers growing wheat and barley are concerned with stock-piling. Several farmers stated, without being asked, that they are now against the EEC, and will vote against the Government at the next election.
